text: Eva Evelyn Burrows, AC (15 September 192920 March 2015) was an Australian community welfare organiser. From 1986 to 1993, Burrows served as the 13th General of the Salvation Army. She served as an Officer of the Salvation Army from 1951 to her retirement in 1993. Burrows died on 20 March 2015 at a hospital in Melbourne, Victoria, aged 85. ==References== ==Other websites== * Biography and Interview from Australian Biography Online * General Eva Burrows, biography at Women's International Center * "Why Help the Poor?" – A condensed version of an address delivered by General Burrows at the opening session of the Third Asia-Pacific Regional Workshop on Banking with the Poor held in Brisbane 21–25 November 1995. * Burrows, Eva Evelyn in The Encyclopedia of Women and Leadership in Twentieth-Century Australia Category:1929 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Australian Christians Category:People from Newcastle, New South Wales
title: Eva Burrows
